article.headline: Holy Cross 84, Lafayette 74
article.story: EASTON, Pa. (AP) -- Keith Simmons scored 26 points and led four scorers in double figures as Holy Cross opened its Patriot League season with an 84-74 victory over Lafayette on Saturday. Simmons shot 9-for-12 from the field, including 4-for-6 from 3-point range for Holy Cross (10-6, 1-0). Torey Thomas scored 18 points, Tim Clifford added 11 and Pat Doherty 10. Bilal Abdullah shot 6-for-7 from the field and 7-for-8 from the line and led Lafayette (6-10, 0-1) with 22 points. Ted Detmer scored 11 and Everest Schmidt added 10.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
